alert.note: Alert for Kennebec (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 03 at 11:23AM EDT until May 05 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warnings are extended for the following rivers in New Hampshire...Maine... Saco River At Conway affecting Cumberland, Carroll and Oxford Counties. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Kennebec and Somerset Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Suncook River At North Chichester affecting Belknap and Merrimack Counties. Lamprey River Near Newmarket affecting Rockingham and Strafford Counties. For the Saco River...including Conway...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Kennebec River...including Skowhegan, North Sidney, Augusta, Hallowell...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Suncook River...including North Chichester...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Lamprey River...including Newmarket...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Augusta. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Water begins to flood parking lots on Front Street in Augusta. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 12.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM EDT Wednesday was 20.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 12.7 feet early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
